column4: I thought I installed ubuntu 64bit but I'm trying to install a .deb that's labeled amd64 and it says amd64 does not match my architecture (i386)...how do I figure this out?
Damn...I could have sworn I'd installed 64bit....I guess I go back and reinstall
Please, dude.  Don't accuse me of something crazy like that.
Believe me, I know.  I'm clear on the advantages/disadvantages
Nah.  I'm a programmer and kernel hacker.
I believe the term is kernel modder.
Fair.  I don't generally tend to edit code, but rather play with patches and whatnot.
Hmm...I don't remember specifically trying it.  I do remember having real time mode of jackd working a while back when I was doing some audio stuff
But I don't know if you're referring to something newer with more true real time abilities than that required
I know I was running some subset of the rt patches for a while
No, sadly.  That's one area where we're really behind and it's the reason I keep a windows partition around.  Makes me die a little inside.
Ardour is supposedly really good, but I haven't tried it.  It's probably not a protools replacement though.
yea gonna get that stuff for him on a trial box and check it out
I've heard great things about ubuntu studio for that sort of thing.  That'd be a good trial box maybe?
